Plot VAR Fitted Values

Source: R/ggvar_fit.R
ggvar_fit.Rd

Plots fitted values of a VAR model, versus the actual values. ggvar_fit Plots each serie in a facet. ggvar_fit_colored plots all in the same graph, each with a different color.

Usage

ggvar_fit(
  x,
  compare = TRUE,
  series = NULL,
  index = 1:x$totobs,
  linetypes = c("solid", "dashed"),
  args_line = list(),
  args_facet = list()
)

ggvar_fit_colored(
  x,
  compare = TRUE,
  series = NULL,
  index = 1:x$totobs,
  colors = NULL,
  linetypes = c("solid", "dashed"),
  args_line = list()
)

Arguments

x

A "varest" object to get fitted values from.

compare

Logical, should the "original" values be plotted?

series

A character vector with variables (column names) to consider. Defaults to all (NULL).

index

A vector of labels to the x-axis, normally dates. Must have length equal to x$obs. Defaults to a numeric sequence.

linetypes

A vector of line types (original, predicted). Passed toscale_linetype_manual.

args_line

Aditional arguments passed to geom_line.

args_facet

Aditional arguments passed to facet_wrap.

colors

A vector of colors for each variable. Passed toscale_color_manual. See vignette("colors").

Value

An object of class ggplot.

Examples

x <- vars::VAR(freeny[-2])
ggvar_fit(x, args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))

ggvar_fit_colored(x)
